headline.main: Ideas & Trends; Harvard Inc., a New Conglomerate, Is Up for Debate Obesity: A Case Of Less Is More Saturn Surrenders Two More Secrets Mass. Fails Test On Death Penalty Studies Trace the Cancer Color Line
Obesity: A Case; Of Less Is More

docs.lead_paragraph: For decades, specialists in the treatment of obesity have spoken cautiously of an agent that could, when taken orally, burn up unwanted fat stored in the body's tissues. Such a ''thin pill'' may now be on the horizon. The New England Journal of Medicine reported last week that researchers at Harvard University have discovered a biochemical abnormality in some obese people that may account for their condition. This follows earlier experiments that had detected a similar abnormality in laboratory mice.
